remarks.format:
## 解説 The identifier for a rule is a string that contains the name of the rule.
A value used to set <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.SrgsGrammar.SrgsRule.Id%2A> must adhere to the following rules:
- The value must be a valid XML name, as defined in [Extensible Markup Language \(XML\) 1.0 \(Fifth Edition\)](http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/). To paraphrase this definition, a valid XML name must begin with a letter, an underscore \('\_'\), or a colon \(':'\) and can be followed by zero or more NameChar characters \(also defined in the XML specification\).
- The value can be "NULL" or "VOID" or "GARBAGE".
- The value cannot contain any invalid rule ID character. These characters are: '?', '\*', '\+', '|', '\(', '\), '^', '$', '\/', ';', '.', '\=', '\<', '\>', '\[', '\]', '{', '}', '\\\\', ' ', '\\t', '\\r', and '\\n'.
